Review title: Full Of Action One Of The Best.
Review_body:
Best Action Movie of all movie world
I have never seen movie like this Indonesia salute for making this kind of movie.
I was recently watched this movie, it is full meals for action lovers.
I like it this is cute. BADASSjsjajsjbsnkabsbjwjsjusja.

I liked the movie - it has great action scenes and the pacing is great. I couldn't keep my eye away from the screen when there was fighting going on. Few gripes though - it's funny to see the lead circle his arms in the air during some scenes but that's because he's going to defend himself against an attack, but it just looks funny and more amateur than say the scene where he fights the assassin in the kitchen, or the introduction of the antagonists. There's also a lot of camera movement that it seems the arms flailing is on purpose to suggest action, which is lame - the lead is a badass cop so he shouldn't be looking like an idiot.

Among us there must be an ever watched romantic comedy films in the cinema while-do mention "ooowwwhhh!" on romantic scenes. It is 'almost identical' occurs when watching The Raid on the big screen, most of the audience-do mention (shouts) "wuanjengggg!" Haha! Once was willing titled as 'Serbuan Maut' for domestic distribution is indeed thrusting action scenes that make the audience swore and more swearing! I watched The Fighter and Warrior which present the tightened the audience to watch the live alike battle martial arts fight. However, The Raid able to make more glaring eyes witnessed the martial action almost without pause.In contrast to Gareth Evans who had served in Merantau (2009), a film premiere at the Toronto International Film Festival is concocting all kinds of battles and fights, as well as presenting a gun battle. It is still promoting martial arts fighting action, but this time free use of sharp weapons (indeed anything!) and far more brutal than ever shown in Merantau.Enthusiasts of the genre of action films must have been familiar with all the style of similar films from around the world ever. American action films off course have a different style from European action films. Asian action movies, particularly Hong Kong, usually the most prominent because of the strong element of self-defense and always looked real on the big screen. Well we'll find a mix of all styles in film action film The Raid; action of an armed attack is felt America / Europe be continued with Asian martial arts fighting action. This produces a combined massive action scenes are very-very horrible! A background of Gareth Evans who was born in Wales - England but with childhood joy watching action films of Hong Kong production may partly explain the action formula presented in The Raid. Choreographed action scenes and cinematography Gareth arranged with Iko Uwais and Yayan Ruhiyan for six months before the official start shooting generate an excellent visualization of action scenes.Among the action scenes that can make the audience breathless, The Raid slightly poor in terms of story. The story was only explaining the relationship between the main characters and tuck the twist which not too surprising (although not easily predictable). The story is a formula that has been common in genre films like; humble hero, raid, trap, crime boss watch dog who is hard to beat, twist the story, the truth / goodness still wins. It's OK. And Gareth has chosen to sell the actions.Performance of the actors in The Raid may be divided into two categories: the character role and the action role. Action role presented so dogged by Iko Uwais (Rama) and Donny Alamsyah (Andi). Joe Taslim (Jaka) who appears as the commander can also look fierce with a lot of improvisation from Judo. But the top champion of action should be pinned to Yayan Ruhiyan who plays Mad Dog a cold, a bit silly, but super fierce. My advice, never close your eyes when watching the 'threesome' scene of Mad Dog with Andi and Rama! Henky Solaiman was always able to steal the show though here only appears briefly as a father who is concerned about the safety of his son. But the audience will be mesmerized by the appearance of Ray Sahetapy who plays Tama, a local Mafia boss character who is very relaxed, but cold and cruel. Shown eating instant noodles in short pants when facing the caught intruders, Ray is able to make my skin crawl because it looks so real and it may be a representation / characterization of real local criminal boss! Gareth Evans once again finished the film with the ending 'open'. Although without a convinced story, one thing that can be obtained from The Raid is that in this world no man is pure good or bad.

when I arrived at The cinema at my home town to day, it currently show 6 movies, The Hunger Games, John Carter, Man on the ledge, Woman In Black, Ghost Rider Vengeance and The Raid. So I decided to go for the local first (yes I'm in Indonesia) and Hollywood Blockbuster 3D for the last, which something that I regret at the and of the day. The Raid is actually a lame movie, compare with The Hunger Games for ex. With a simple plot, something that you already seen in many Hollywood movies before, and a very corny dialog, it seem that its being written in English and translated to Indonesian.But Holly S*it man the action is **c**** Awesome....I'm actually hold my breath for nearly 60 minutes of this movie. Because that is what this movie is all about. breathtaking The scene is very tense, minute to minute. It's brutal that visualize in a beautiful choreographs. The Best Action Movie I've seen in decade. Yes I know, Hard Boiled, Oldboys and even Tony Jaa's cannot do what this movie did to me. I'm planning to watch it again tomorrow. I had to, the action is just worth some more viewing. And why I regret watching this movie first, because It made the rest of that day completely dry. When I watch John Carter after this movie, I felt really boring. Because I can still felt the knife that stab a man 2 times in the chest and rip off a man knee.so if you are a twilight fan (idiotic teenage girl and gay) this movie is not for you. but if you are made completely of testosterone, go watch this movie, It is made for you.

Review title: Most overrated IMDb movie about brainless people(little spoiler)
Review_body: Camera, music, plot, action - almost everything is OK, it's a good movie to watch, quite interesting, but: swat and criminals actions are completely stupid.little spoilers from the beginning of movie: - nobody calls for backup... their raid is unofficial, so they can't call for backup - fail - armed enemies trying to break door barricaded by police instead of shooting through the door- fail - no 'global' coordination, guy checks 1st floor situation after clearing sixth floor...wow that's what I call frequentand so on...So how is it possible that this movie has so high score? Are there so stupid swat teams? Come on. It's good movie, but these senseless actions are just ridiculous and irritating.

Review title: The best action movie ever, ever.
Review_body: I found IMDb by researching competition for a movie quote website. This will be the first movie review I have typed on IMDb.That being said, this is the BEST action movie I have ever seen. I won't go into all the complexities that others have, I'll just say that there is NONE of the pretentiousness or expectatiousness (new word) of your heroes here. The action between the antagonists and protagonists is VERY real. The action throughout puts you into the mindset of kill or be killed... there is no expectation of outcome.The best way I can express this is, when you have a fight scene, nit will be the most realistic fight scene that you have ever seen.

Solid flick, but ratings over 7 are absurd. "Best martial arts movie in decades"??? Common people, watch ANY Tony Jaa movie...no comparison. Or Donnie Yen...see "Flashpoint" for truly 'the best'. I like Uwais as a martial artist a lot, and being the first Silat action star is really cool, as an actor (or even an action star) tho, much room for improvement. He just doesn't have that 'style' or 'flare' Bruce Lee harnessed, and we see in Jaa, Yen, or Jackie Chan. Uwais is very nearly comparable to Jet Li (if you don't count "The Warlords"), which is absolutely a complement. Just not the "best" like too many of these people have been saying.

My favorite action movie before watching the raid was IP Man . But when I Watched The Raid make me change my mind. Yes the raid was surprisingly great action movie. Although the story is not really deep, but the action movie was great. I recommend to anyone who not yet watching this movie to watch and enjoy all the movie. Iko uwais who play as main actor in this film was brilliant act in martial art that bring silat ( indonesian martial art ). Also the acting of yayan ruhian as fillain or bad gay ( mad Dog ) make me scared . Also don't forget about joe taslim in this film ( he won a gold medal in indonesian competition of judo ) . OK now i will tell about the story , the story about this movie is about group of Indonesia SWAT team that will raiding one apartment in jakarta . The apartment was loan to the many bad guy that no one police can touch that building . The building have 30 floor. Their mission was to capture the lord of drag ( TAMA acted by Ray Sahetapy ) . Tama have two loyal body guard . One of them is Mad Dog ( Really really the bad guy in this movie ) . Don't forget to see the duel between Mad Dog and Iko Also Mad Dog and Joe Taslim . Overall about this movies was Excellent. So don't miss it .

While looking for movie to watch, I have found recommendation on the internet to watch The Raid: Redemption Here is my impression: As I saw quite high grade (7.8) I thought that it must be great movie not Hollywood like, but something really specific that just must not be missed.Positive user reviews made me believe that its "one of a kind".What have I seen? Boom, the most stupid screenplay ever, boring scenes where good guys fight against bad ones.Poor imitation of Hollywood (which I don't like) and Bruce Lee (LOL) style.There is several nice fighting moves, but they repeat all the time, and is becoming painfully boring to watch it as movie goes along.Plot is really plain and very simple, other than fighting there is nothing happening here.Aldo I don't love Bruce Lee or Chuck Norris movies, I have to admit that they are far better than this one.Final mark: 2/10 - Only thing I don't understand about this film, is how come that it has so many positive reviews when there is absolutely NOTHING interesting in it. (acting is average tho)

Review title: Great fight scenes , but no story
Review_body: as a brief describe for this movie I can say : -It's an action movie but it's problem that it doesn't have a story behind, and it suffers from lack of plot and suspense, so in some point I had a feeling that it's more close to a horror film.-It contains a lot of powerful fight sequences from all kinds(guns fight, hand to hand combat , knifes clashing..) some of them could be too long, and some is too brutal.-If you are a martial arts fan you would enjoy this movie (even-though I didn't!) but if you aren't so I don't recommend watching.Finally, I admit that it's a decent Indonesian film, and it's a big step for the Indonesian films industry, but it still needs a lot of work and improvements to become an international movie.

Review title: Flawless action film packed with excitement!
Review_body: Flawless is an understatement for this film. I sat down to watch it with my brother, expecting yet another of these boring foreign films with a lack of thrill and shoddy fight scenes and shoot outs - but oh boy I was wrong! Now if you were to watch this film, the first thing you may think is that they aren't speaking English.. this is correct, as the whole film in fact is in Indonesian, and subtitled with English. Now unless you speak fluent Indonesian, then you may find it a difficult task to criticise the quality of the acting just as me and my brother did. However, in a way I saw this as a good thing.. with a film SO action packed, it means you can spend less time focused on the acting and more time focused on the ambitious stunts and intricate fight scenes. Therefore, this moves me on to the next point, the stunt director did a seriously, seriously, seriously good job. It's so realistic! Fights aren't all just a '1-2' punch combo followed by being catapulted through a window, and slow motion explosions.. it genuinely seems like they are trying to kill each other! Now admittedly, action isn't the only criteria for a good film.. but The Raid is a GREAT film, it has the perfect balance of ups and downs, and a brilliant plot which makes the 2 hours of Indonesian speaking, breath taking, edge of your seat action worth not only the watch, but also the 4 awards it won.

Most of the reviews might be from the native country of this movie. It's an average action movie with no plot and below average acting. The end of the movie goes nowhere.May i have seen better but above 7 was too much it's not even 5

Review title: Great action, martial arts, music, and story!
Review_body: The first time I heard of this movie I was just excited to see the Asian guys in it (I'm a girl who loves her Asian men ;D), but after I sat down in the theater and watched this entire movie with my jaw a-gape, I realized what an amazing feature this had really been. Between the subtle, yet recognizable story and the gruesome (without being over-gory) non-stop action scenes, this movies finds itself in the top of my own personal arsenal of great Indonesian films. Not only is all of the music's soundtrack produced by Linkin Park's very own Mike Shinoda and Deftone's Chino Moreno, but the film also stars budding actor, Iko Uwais, an amazing Silat fighter from Indonesia (also stars in director Gareth Evan's Merantau).If you get the chance to see this movie prepare to be both horrified and unified by this film. You will truly be disgusted and completely enthralled by the film's close that you'll just want to kick something! (Or knee barrage something Silat style!) All I can really say is that I'm a normal person giving a great review, take what you will from this film, but I believe this amazing movie is worth your time.

Review title: do anything to see this film
Review_body: This is my first review on here having been a member for a long time, but i felt compelled to tell people to watch this film. So its 20 cops, 15 floors, and 2 hours of me fist pumping in the air. Never have I spent an entire duration of a film before, just wanting to shout OMG! the audience around me gasped at every ultra-violent gory death scene thrown at us, sometimes out of sheer wonder at how they even managed to do it! Yes, there's lots and lots and lots of action, but there is a story, a simple but strong and ever-present story, which is never predictable and keeps you guessing all the way through. This film is an 18 year old boy's utter dream, and yes I am an 18 year old boy, and yes i did think it was one of the best films I HAVE EVER SEEN. Whatever you do, don't think about going to see this film, make your mind up and go before it leaves our cinema's forever! Im sure it'll be better than the planned US remake.

Review title: The most beautiful choreographed violence I've ever seen
Review_body: I won't go into a plot synopsis as it's been done already. Just my reaction to the film. I don't think I have ever seen a more beautifully choreographed action movie. The timing was superb, quite often not giving you enough time to think about what was going to happen next and then in the next, leaving you in suspense. I watched it on the big screen (which I feel is a must) and the true relentlessness of the fighting in one scene left the audience clapping and cheering at the climax. There wasn't much of a plot but it wasn't needed, the film had a cleverness all of it's own in the swift actions of the fighters and the pure beauty of the martial arts. Needless to say...I loved it

It felt like I was watching a very violent version of pornography. What else was there except "extreme violence"? I'm not sure if I can call this an action movie or just a non-stop machete slaughter. The story line wasn't built well enough to explain all the extreme bloodshed. Effects were pretty good, but it was only to make the scenes look even more gruesome. Maybe it was based on some kind of a computer game, and kids these days follow what's more provocative. Then they have youtube or thousands of other private websites that are up for only violent scenes. Movie making involves building characters, writing a proper scenario, and decent acting too. It should also involve social responsibilities as to how they may influence the viewers, especially young or psychologically unstable ones. The more shocking fact is that this movie now got 7.8, so I had to do something. Cheers! Let's make movies and stay sane!

Review title: The Raid: The Most Badass Movie of 2012
Review_body: from the studio that brought us crouching tiger, hidden dragon and kung fu hustle, i can honestly say this is one of my favorite movies of all time, and most likely the greatest film of 2012. easy to get past the foreign language when most of it is insane kung fu ninja awesomeness, shooting, and suspense, but the dialog is still pretty great. hopefully the company goes for some Oscar pushes, at least in foreign language film. the choreography of this film is insane. great performances by the whole cast that were not necessary but still given. iko uwasawi is the most badass ninja since Jet Li. Rainn cannot compete with Iko or any other badass like mad dog in this film. please see this film immediately.

I get a new experience of watching an action film The Raid. not only accelerated the adrenaline of seeing the fight scenes are fun but there is little sense of horror. So is the tension that gets interspersed with a little humor. Make the experience of watching this movie, like being a Raid-coaster ride. A great experience that will not be forgotten. I love this.The story in this film is actually quite simple. We are invited to see the struggle of a hero in saving his life level by level from easy to most difficult in an apartment. Interspersed with a little background to spice up the story in this film.A movie-viewing experience unforgettable.

From the outset, characters talk in their local tongue, followed by English subtitles at the bottom of the screen. these disappear so fast that I struggled to keep up with conversations at some points.Admittedly there was around 15 minutes of total speech, but the conversations were so boring that you got tired of it after a few seconds!The fighting skills were superb admittedly, however there is such a thing as too much of a good thing! At one stage you see 2 main characters fighting mad dog. At a rough guess they should've broken his legs, arms and several other limbs around 20 times... each! But he kept getting back up. This was a little too much for me.I couldn't help but think they put a plot in after finding a lot of martial artists wanting to make a movie about beating each other several shades of blue.Overall very disappointed, don't waste your money unless you like movies such as the house of flying daggers. See Battleship instead, better action and a better plot!

Review title: Let the bodies hit the floor, wall and table.
Review_body: The plot of "The Raid: Redemption" is beautifully simple. A SWAT team who have broken into a tower block controlled by a gang lord have become trapped inside and the few that remain must fight their way out. There are a few other subplots that drift into focus occasionally, but they are described so vaguely and have almost no relevance to the action, it's as though the filmmakers knew they were kidding themselves. All that matters here is the action.Usually I'd criticise a film for sticking to the basics and not risk being original, but it's had to care when one lone cop is taking on corridor after corridor full of opponents, using only his fists, feet and occasional knife for good measure. Audiences' queasy at the sight of blood should probably stay away; the brutality in this film cannot be exaggerated. I can't remember the last time (if ever) I have winced so loudly at what I was watching. Heads disappear into walls, knives into throats, bodies are pummelled so relentlessly it's amazing the characters don't crawl hands and knees into the next scene. Thankfully, the film is superbly directed by Brit director Gareth Evans so the action remains coherent and instead of feeling repetitive and tiresome we are left hanging for the next fight. Instead of resorting to the confused shaky cam of the generic Hollywood thriller, Evans knows when to step back and let the audience revel in the amazingly choreographed fights or other times follow the cops through holes in the floor or even as they fall three floors from a window onto a fire escape in mid-fight. (I learn that Hollywood is planning their inevitable remake which will be sure to correct this for brain dead audiences leaving Alex Cross.) We mostly stick with rookie cop Rama (Iko Uwais) as he tries to help his injured friend escape in between battering one charging tenant after another. Some people have likened this film to a video game and I don't disagree. As soon as one opponent is dispatched, another eagerly steps forward oblivious to the dark stain on the wall that seconds before was his predecessor. Even the climactic showdown with the gang leader's henchman feels much like a boss fight. Uwais deserves credit for giving Rama at least enough personality to root for him as he charges through the movie, assisted no doubt by the lazy cliché of the Pregnant Wife Back At Home. He deserves even more for his astonishing martial art skills, which are easier to simply watch in awe than for me to describe.Some people will criticise this film for not bringing anything new to the table (other than the bloody heads of tenants) in the way of character development or an interesting plot and to some extent I agree. Had the director maybe taken the time before entering the building to establish Rama's character more and build on the reason for them being there I probably would have admired "The Raid: Redemption" even more. But there are times when I really couldn't care less whether a movie transcends its genre or provides me with an emotionally enriching experience. I just want to see s#!t beat up.As a side note, the "Redemption" in the title can't help but feel irrelevant, unless redemption involves killing a lot of people or it is just establishing the possibility of a "Raid" franchise. If the latter is true, count me in.

Review title: This is seriously for an action film fans..
Review_body: I'd say this movie can be enjoyed mostly for those who loved to know how to disarm tough opponents properly. The balance between the bad guy and the good guy skills, chances to win battle in a fight nearly equal. So you won't see any single-strike attack to bring your opponents down, except by a bullet.The fights look so real, so beautifully choreographed. And the main actor (Iko) do have charisma in him to be a good guy. Also, the supporting actors did their roles in very correct portions. There's one actor who played as the insanely tough fight-freak, Mad Dog (Yayan) skill and fight scenes will convince you that this guy is the last guy on earth you want to make a mess with!But there are still some flaws though, scenes that will seem doesn't make a sense to you, how actors acted to solve situation. And poor story, lack of backgrounds/times that's given to develop the intended plot, especially for a betrayal intrigue, pity just make the movie looks lil bit ridiculous to me instead.If you like FREAK ACTION MOVIE! you gotta see this on theater!7.8/10

Finally watched this movie after so many people (on the internet) recommending it, and well, it's one of the very few Indonesian movies which is known abroad, so it has been piquing my interest for quite sometime.And, it did not disappoint. Despite the story being very straightforward, with almost no depth to it, the rest was spot on. Never-ending action throughout, accompanied by subtle, but nicely timed background music; and that ending... totally lived up all the hype.

If you love an action movie, you should watch this. Despite lack of dialogs but the action scenes could cover it. The effect is pretty good I might say. But, looks like there's a thing that being missed, this movie suddenly take us into the ambush. There's no explanation why the building is not a cop jurisdiction. How the Drug Lord free to produce his drugs in the building (bribery etc.). Why the Drug Lord choose that building as his fortress. How the criminals stock their weapons like AK-47, Sniper's gun. How there still a nice persons live in that building. Above of it, this movie really show what is "Pencak Silat" all about. Indonesian martial arts is look really amazing all over action scenes in this movie.

Review title: The Raid, Don't Think Just Watch !
Review_body: The Raid aka "Serbuan Maut", A spectacular action film filled with scenes of sadistic and bloody in though with 'Silat' movements that make you in awe.The story is quite simple, A SWAT team was sent to arrest a criminal kingpin who lives in an apartment, which happened in the apartment was managed by him, and filled with vicious criminals, and hardship in their invasion of the action begins once known by residents of apartments, finally the massacre after massacre occurred from one floor to another floor.This film just sells action "Silat" & Bullets, do not think too much with all the gaps, because you are not given a chance to think (and breathe) to see all the fight scenes with all the terrible and bloody gore. Like watching a perfect action video game, filled with full scenes of bullets shooting and fist fights.The film also slipped some humor, unfortunately Indonesian may be just the person who would find it funny when hear the dialect from of one of the goons dialog.Ray 'Tama' Sahetapy is the only one I think is was good in the acting; he could make criminal sadistic characters, crazy and authoritative.Regardless of the deficiencies that exist, this film deserves to be on the watch for fans of action films and is very dear to the miss it.Hopefully in the 'Brandal the next sequel, there is an improvement on the story and acting...Once Again, don't miss this movie !!!!

Review title: Full action packed movie, awesome martial arts choreography, yet dull storyline
Review_body: The Raid offers you intense non-stop full action and awesome stylish martial arts choreography featuring extreme relentless bloody violence. You wouldn't found any significant plot here, in other words there's nothing to tell about the storyline. Once you have decided to watch this movie, leave your brain outside the cinema's door and enjoy the fighting.Probably, not everyone will enjoy scene-by-scene fightings without essential supporting storyline -which is, probably The Raid was never designed to provide that since the beginning-. What I can say, this kind of movie perhaps has its own specific audiences. If you are amongst of them, you should RATE The Raid with 9 AT THE LEAST!!To think again, Gareth Evans, the director probably wants us to leave our brain outside the cinema's door, don't analyze anything, don't ask what's behind the story, just enjoy the non-stop actions and The Raid will make you hold your breath for more than 60 minutes!!!I am, exactly, not amongst of those. I'm an audience who enjoy the balanced action movie, deep storyline and strong action. But once I know what kind of movie The Raid is, as I said, I set my expectation, change my perspective, therefore I enjoyed watching the movie whilst holding my breath on!! :D

Review title: no doubt the Raid is the best action movie ever, fight sequence of Silat is amazing!
Review_body: this amazing well masterly fight choreographed movie is no doubt one of the best action movie in decades. an elite police squad have main task to terminate the drug lord Tama in his 30-floor building in slum area of Jakarta, but when the SWAT entering the building everything goes a catastrophe. it about an elite police squad lead by Jaka (Joe Taslim) to raid crime kingpin Tama in his 30fl building, but when the SWAT team entering the building, they trapped in, no way out, all criminal in that building have been ordered by Tama to kill every single officer.as a newbie in the squad, Rama (Iko Uwais) found himself has to fight or die. and after that all stunning and awesome fight sequence choreographically will entertain all of the action movie fan. all you'll see are show off of superb Indonesian traditional martial art called Pencak silat. the action scene you never seen before, and for sure i believe Hollywood can make this kind of action fight.a can promise, yo'll never regret see the raid. go see it!!

Review title: From my opinion, one of the best action movie in decades!
Review_body: well i'll just say that for an underdog movie, this is a phenomenal job. it offers you some action of Silat and many other things that cannot be describe with words. This movie is so worth of your time and it is worth watching or rather a must watch action movie ! the sound effect is also very good, when the knife fight or gun fight or even fist fight. it is superb. so don't waste your time no more! go watch "The Raid"PS Better not bring your couple with you, the bloody part and the fighting part is quite harsh but if you've watched saw then its fine i guess.

First, i don't know what the film is until my girlfriend ask to to watch this awesome movie.... This is the first Indonesian movie with best Dolby Digital so far I know... best sound design ever... i like the movie scoring when Doggy kill Jaka. i like how the film scorer make the scoring try to mute all of sound effect just using some pad in lower key to produce a sound like "whhhooooooooooooooo" come out from the theater sub woofers... its really fantastic. it can make the audience feel the tension from this act...feel how the pain it is. congratulation... i prod of you guys (the film maker) hope there will be another Indonesian movies like "The Raid" :)

Review title: The Best ACTION, THRILLER MOVIE that I ever Watched!
Review_body: It is DANGEROUS! Watching this Movie make your Heart Stop for a while! Non Stop thrill from the Beginning until the End. It will make your Body Hurts, especially your heart. Coz the sound of this movie really want to kill you! (and believe me that the fight and shooting scene will definitely make your mind blow away...)Well, you call me an Old Fashioned guy because I always like a martial art with hand style from years such as Ong Bak, Jet Lee or Jackie Chan movies. So, you can definitely believe what I am saying about this Review, because I am a very Big Fan of Action Movies. Maybe it is also too early to say this because the Director and the Player (G. Evans and Iko Uwais) only play 2 big movies until now. Comparable to Jet Lee or Jackie Chan who has spend so many years doing their movies. But, I am very sure.. That Iko Uwais is better than those two persons :)Trust Me... You Won't Regret watching this Movie.... It will KILL YOU! Your Body will SUFFER! Coz It's Damn Good!Finally : The Best ACTION, THRILLER MOVIE that I ever Watched! --> 10/10

Review title: One of the GREATEST Action Movies EVER!!!
Review_body: Pure non-stop action is what this movie is all about! If you are a fan of martial arts/action movies, you must see this whenever you can. The camera angles are perfectly shot to keep you involved in the movie. A lot of times, I felt as if I was right by the actors. The music is perfect and syncs well with each scene of the movie.There is an extreme amount of fighting, blood and gore, and profanity, so I don't think this will be for the kids lol.The story is put together very well and has a few twists and turns that keep you on the edge of your seat.GO SEE THIS MOVIE!

I've been waiting for this flick for almost a year now and it was worth every single day of wait. The Raid didn't get too much press or hype in the media, giving the fact that Sony would like it to bomb, maybe only to give the future crappy American remake that much more praise when its redone with cheesy dialogue, overused/overrated actors, and a nice PG-13 rating. I'm new to this whole IMDb review thing but after watching it last night, I had to! This movie is nonstop action. I heard a few complaints while watching it in the theater though. A man said he didn't know it was subtitled, which should be obvious. Indonesian's don't speak English. And a woman said it was too bloody. YES its a violent movie!!! Violent and realistic. I give HUGE ups to the stunt men on this movie. They mos def earned their money. The Raid took my number 2 slot in my best movie ever collection. I suggest this movie to any action junkie who loves action movies that can READ.

Review title: Not Really A Fair Review. More of a Warning.
Review_body: As I only suffered through the first 45 minutes of this film, it's not really fair for me to write a review. But I just wanted to warn others out there who may be like me - people who have a medium tolerance for violence - that this is one of the most horrifically violent movies I've ever seen the first 45 minutes of. I have walked out of 3 movies in my life. This is the 3rd.If you love non-stop action, little dialog and a plot that does not really matter, this movie is for you. If you need a plot to justify the violence, this is NOT a movie for you. I heard from my friends who stuck it out that I missed 2 pretty awesome martial arts sequences, and I was disappointed about that. But the constant (and I do mean constant - balls to the wall- one killing spree to the next with virtually no interlude) explicit and no holds barred violence was too much for this viewer.

Review title: One of the most entertaining films there is!
Review_body: My dad bought this movie on DVD some time ago. It looked to me to be just another average, over-the-top action movie except in a different language. But, after sitting in a press for a few days, I decided to watch it out of boredom. Best decision I'd made for quite some time!This is NOT just another average, over-the-top action movie except in a different language, this is a near perfect action movie. Some would say the action is indeed over-the-top, those people are just plain wrong. The action is beautiful, artistic even. The violence in this movie I cannot compare to any other. It doesn't rely on a brilliant plot or Oscar-worthy acting, instead relying on violence, violence and more violence. That's not to say the entire film is just fighting. We are introduced to the plot, it goes wrong and the main characters become trapped. From here, the film goes from one amazing fight scene, to a break. In this break from the action, characters are developed. Then another big action scene followed by a break. This cycle occurs three or four times in the film. While this seems rather boring, I assure you it is not. The Raid: Redemption, through accident, has become one of my favorite movies of all time and one which I am constantly recommending to everyone I can... If you haven't seen it yet and are on the fence, WATCH IT!

I like this movie so much, I had to write a review...When i saw it at the theaters i tell you, i didn't even want to go to the bathroom because i was afraid i would miss something. Even though my family and I were confused about where they originated from, we were too busy into the movie to even care anymore. I went with my mother and my neighbor's, and i lie to you not, it kept me at the edge of my seat! I was nervous, scared, excited, and happy all at the same time. I am in my late teenage years, so maybe it was better to me than for some, but i am smart enough to know a good movie. I haven't saw an action movie like this in a very long time. If you are looking to see it, viewer discretion is advised. There is a lot of bones, blood, and realistic-looking incidents in the movie, but to me it just made it better. Thumbs up!!

Review title: A Must-Watch for Action Movie Junkies!
Review_body: To manage my expectation before watching this movie, i took into the consideration the small budget (just slightly above $1mio) that went into it and their casting of lesser-known actors. I must say, it really beat my expectation. There have been other movies which were produced from a much more bigger budget which failed to deliver as much as this movie. As I left the theater, i made a mental note to find and watch Gareth Evans' previous works. The plot was simple, yet effective in drawing the audience to appreciate the stylishly choreographed action scenes. You don't get to see the kind of laughable fake punches, untimely sound effects and unrealistic martial art moves which are often evident in many Hollywood production or Hongkong triad-themed movies. Simply put, it is raw and brutal. Intense.When you watch Iko Uwais and Yayan Ruhian (Mad Dog) fight, you will realize how much more realistic and admirable their choreography is, as compared to the likes of Jackie Chan and Jet Li.If there's an area which I wished the movie had explored, it would be the character development. While the portrayal of Tama by Ray Sahetapy was adequate in showing his scarily-cool-but-sadistic appetite for brutality, the director failed or chose not to explore the depth of other characters such as Rama, Andi and Jaka. Iko Uwais, despite being new to the acting craft, has the potential to give more. During one of the twist in the movie, the director could have let him show more emotion as a man-in-conflict. The audience would have felt more for the characters -- thus giving the movie a more meaningful substance and an emotional experience for the audience.I heard that there might be a Hollywood remake... I dread this. Would rather it remain like cult- like movie than an over-commercialized one, bastardized with over-the-top ridiculous choreography of fight scenes.

Seriously, this little gem is on its way to becoming a cult classic.It's a hell of a well made movie considering the low budget. This is a fine example of substance over eye candy.Reminds me of John Woo,plus knives - lots of knives! Congrats to the whole crew! Go see the movie and you will be pleasantly surprised by what it has to offer.Well crafted and choreographed, it all adds up to a wild ride.Action fans will appreciate the authenticity of it all.Buzz on the vine suggest a prequel on the way. Hopefully they don't mess it up.

Review title: Worst movie ever , Just another junk.
Review_body: One of the worst movie I have ever seen. Please don't rely on IMDb rating for this movie.I guess the makers of this movie has spent huge money on making false positive review to increase the rating.Wasted 2 hours in my life.Story line is pathetic. The wrong people shooting police in the public and still no one questions them, Isn't this impractical. This movie is thus another kids play, but the makers call it "Best Action movie" , What a good joke. This movie is another junk in the name of action movie.My personal advice is not to waste your time, Instead watching this movie you can jut relax back at home.Don't get cheated by looking at the IMDb's high rating for this movie.

I decided to watch this movie only for one reason "MIKE SHINODA"his music has given a great boost for the movie.But in the end i thought... it was more than i expected.Fights were so real and the cast was great.You cannot expect a good storyline in an action flick.But this has story that you'll never expect.This movie will stuck in my mind for a good long period.Just watch it..You'll never regret it.I hope that Hollywood won't make a remake of it because it won't come up to this level for sure.A low budget such as 1.1 million has surprisingly give the best to the audience.I didn't watch this movie in a theater.If i was.. surely it would be great.I hope that Gareth Evans will make more stuff like this and the crowd surely waiting for it.The bottom line is I'm very proud as an Asian to watch an action flick this quality.

i went to a sneak preview, first there was a man joking that thy where going to view a indonesian like movie.then i was a little sceptic because i thought o no i not a bollywood movie.i went down on my seat and the first 2 minutes i thought daimn it is a bollywood production, but after a few minutes i saw the first gun i thought yeah there is a god :)the rest of the movie i was BLOWN away almost from my seat, so much action and the camera did not even once turned away when somebody gets killed and believe me there where many guys killed.if you like action movies with martial arts give this movie is a must see definitely! and the best thing was i wasn't alone every one that came out of the movie was blown away, we almost have the scratches on our faces from the gunshells and knifes in te movie.sorry for the bad Englisch but iám dutch.for those they want to watch this movie please do you will never regret this one, sit back and let the adrenaline pump trough you.

Normally I don't like full on action films as the scenes with action in it tends to have quick editing, shaky cam, over the top explosions and witty yet cheesy dialogue. However, after I saw the Raid I was taken aback as none of the things that I listed above was in this movie which was absolutely astounding. There's so much clarity among the fight scenes that it almost feels like you're there with the fighters. The film is beautifully directed, I can't see any other way for it to be so for the stupid remake. Not only has this changed the action genre in a significant way it also made me appreciate foreign films more. Yes, there are bad things about this movie but imo they are very minor and the way this movie was shot makes you look pass that. Watching all those kung fu flicks when Evans was a boy, paid off for him in this and his previous film, Merantau. Kudos to you sirPeople keep saying that this is the best action film since Ong Bak, in no way is it the best film since Ong Bak, its the best film in decades. Ong is quite cringe worthy because of the acting that is displayed on screen and also because of the overused slo mo effect the director used when Jaa did something 'cool'. There are parts within the Raid that has slo mo in them but Evans made sure it was used in the most necessary wayIgnore the review that Roger Elbert had given this movie (1/4 stars) as he clearly doesn't understand nor appreciate a well made film that proves that you don't need to have much depth in your characters or in your story. Though he does point out some NOT all good reasons as to why the film wasn't for him but some of these reasons are beyond ridiculous. This movie was beyond my expectations, it was beautifully directed and the fight scenes were very much believable, the guy who did the sound effects for the punches and the kicks should also be thanked for it to be believable as s/he didn't use those effects where you could obviously tell that those punches or kicks didn't land.Thank u Mr Evans for showing Hollywood that you don't need a billion dollar budget to make a good action flick and needing such a sophisticated storyline and character depth and that all you need is to be smart at what you do.OK the ones who say that there is shaky cam in the fight sequences are freakin retarded, I couldn't even see the camera shaking when the fight scenes were on, they were as clear as day. Also, people saying 'oh everyone in the building knows some type of martial arts, how typical' in their review or on the discussion board needs to watch this film again, NOT everyone knew how to fight it was only some. If you think that holding and shooting a gun, wielding a machete around or throwing a couple of punches is some form of martial arts then wow you must have an IQ of a room temperature.

I saw the ratings on IMDb for this movie which was 7.8, and I was really expecting a great movie since 7.8 is a pretty high rating. However, things turn out a little weird since the beginning of the movie. A SWAT squad just goes out for an unofficial mission to wipe out a whole building that has a reputation of being a killing floor? WTF??!? and everyone in the squad is equipped with a M16/M4 for an in-door mission? Does the director even know what SWAT stands for? The plot is so terrible that I can go watch a porn and say it had a good plot.The action was a little entertaining at the start of the movie, but it gets boring every minute as the movie goes on. How the gangsters fight with the main character is just ridiculous. Did they all go to the same gym to learn how to fight? This is just a Ong-Bak rip off with the worst story ever.This movie is one of those 'one-dimensional films'. Devastating plot, too much fight scenes, worst directing. I wanted to give a 0 but 1 was the lowest rating.

i really didn't think i would ever rate a movie 10/10. but i'm doing so now without a 2nd thought.the script in nothing special, the dialogs blow your mind. But let me just say this: it's just a real Live Stream looking action movie, no silly slow-motion-zoom-in blood filled intercuts, just man against man until one can fight no longer. and it doesn't stop for a second, no bathroom breaks, trust me.my only problem with this move is that i will never be able to enjoy another martial arts action film again.Now stop reading reviews and go see it :)

Please don't rent this movie.Save yourself a BIG disappointment.I rented this movie because it has so many high ratings.I don't know why everyone else rates this so high.The first part of the movie is very good and interesting, but that is just the first 15/20 minutes.The rest of the movie is just a very BAD joke. Exaggerated and with bad actors.It's the same old bad movie, where the "bad guy" just won't die!Please rent any other movie, besides this bad comedy.

Review title: Would rather have had to read subtitles
Review_body: The action was great. If I could rate on the fight sequences alone, I would rate this film much higher. One can easily tell the main actors are professional athletes that actually know martial arts. These are not some American actors who train for some months to pass as practitioners of the arts on film. The problem with this film is the western actors that provided the voice-overs. The timing, tonality, quality and feel of every single voice ruined the film. The performance of the voice over actors caused adequate acting/writing/directing seem poor. I would recommend that the voice over versions be pulled and only versions with the native tongue be available. Does anyone know the studio the provided this service? I think they should stick to providing voice overs for parodies like Kung Pow or not be contracted at all. I should not have found myself thinking about and laughing at the voices that I was hearing. Look, I watched USA Kung Fu Theater every Sunday when I was a youngin'. Those out of sync, western sounding voices had these clowns voice beat hands down. I was craving to read subtitles.

Review title: OK movie if you love action movies
Review_body: I love action movies, especially the ones from Asia. This one however was a complete disappointment, and I can't figure out why so many have rated it above average.The action scenes are made to look good on TV, insanely unrealistic. There is no story, no background, just a bunch of police vs bad-guys fighting. The fighting is impressive in itself, don't get me wrong. It's just so extremely shallow. Don't expect any explanation of anything done in the movie.There's so much they could have done better. In summary; loads of action, loads of unnecessary fighting, no story.I regret wasting time on this movie.

Review title: Best Indonesian Movie ever- Never a dull moment (minor spoilers)
Review_body: Im sure I am not the first to say that thinking close to no-one have ever seen a Indonesian film at all. Put aside that western biased comment for a bit. I don't really like violent films anymore. or i should say "not really into them". but I heard about this martial arts "blockbuster" from I must say was blown away. yes blown of the sofa.. You may have heard statements like "never a dull moment" before and of course so have I. Every movie has SOME dull moments but this one reaches minimum amounts of them. This is not so much a review as an praise to all the unknown (for me) stunt men we only see fractions of seconds of. So many creative fight scenes time and time again. And the almost video-level vs apartment-level analogy is lost only A few. Daxsman approve of this movie and this message :)

I'm always ready for action movies and lately i've only been disappointed by them. I had never even heard of this movie until i rented it. The first 10minutes didn't really strike me as anything but another try-hard-police movie with an little artistic touch. As the movie kept going, i started to get more excited. Even though the story of the movie wasn't that creative but like in 'Taken' it blew me away with the execution of it. The very first shoot-out in the stairway with the slow-mos was brilliant, from that point i didn't think it as a good movie, but rather an art. Fight scenes with Iko Uwais when he's against multiple bad-guys were unbelievable, the field of view it gave to the person watching was great, leaving no move unseen. Why not 10 if i loved it so dearly? Its only because few of the fights went little overboard with how long they lasted.I'd recommend to anyone who appreciates fine martial arts imported to a good action movie.
A Simple and Seek story, but the fight scenes are just awsome

Sorry but this movie is stunningly stupid. If I only could vote multiple times to pull the ratings down to at least 3 stars...! I basically don't care the plot if the fights are good/OK. But besides some good moves they're boring and ridiculous. (A 50kg man beats up 3 70kg - or more - well trained men, 2 of them at once, the 3rd alone but he is a - again - well trained SWAT commander...!!!)The choreography is sort of poor alongside with the cuts/editing as many times you can see the fake moves.I started to watch the movie 3 or 4 months ago and couldn't finish it for it being sooo foolish from the beginning, then now in my boredom I suffered 'till its end.District 13: Ultimatum got 6.4 and this 7.5???!!

Review title: Not worth wasting your time over
Review_body: I gave this a 4, purely out of the level of skill shown by these 'Actors'. The story line was weak, the plot never thickens and the action is just constant. I know that last point sounds like a positive but it was just a bit too ridiculous. Too much money was thrown at the action scenes and not enough on actually having a worthwhile plot, storyline, script or even quality of sound. I had to manually adjust the sound myself, turning it up at the quiet parts and down at the loud parts. It was one of the most frustrating films I have had the miss pleasure of watching.If it wasn't for the extremely well choreographed (Yet ridiculously conceived) fight scenes I would've given this a 1.5*.

This is just the opinion of an indie filmmaker from Northern Ireland, I've never felt led to write a review on a movie before. I have been waiting a long time to sit down and really enjoy this movie with no distractions and today was the day. Wow.So my take on it: John Carpenter meets Ong Bak with the dirty dulcet tones similar to the Dust Brothers. Some of the most visceral and ingenious fight sequences I've ever seen; great choreography. But at the same time, the fighting is realistic not overly 'Hollywood' like normal. Everyone taking hits, getting muscle fatigue and ending up just scrappy because of this. The stamina of those actors and stunt men!The camera work was gritty and fast but not indecipherable with some great angles being utilised. Editing was also tight, with nothing overused or cliché'd. Acting and story had integrity, direction was fantastic, I felt tension throughout the movie, at no point did i get to relax! Even now writing this review i still feel it. Dialogue really has let down some good movies, especially recently, but The Raid had a great script from start to finish. It would have been a perfect 10 for me but i struggled with the Indonesian also, although I'm not sure if English would have been the answer....Cracking job well done Mr. Evans and with a relatively small budget! You have set the bar for many filmmakers. Including myself. It just goes to show that throwing millions at a script does not make the movie.Sai

100 Minutes of pure pulse pounding, extreme creative violence accompanied with a good score. The Raid: Redemption is electric! The Raid takes the best quality's of all of those and more and with the fantastic fight choreography and editing it makes big budget action movies like The Avengers.Definitely one if the best action films I've seen, it was crazy. I couldn't believe some of the stunts!Neither sensible or clever, but it never needs to be. The Raid Redemption is fast, cool, and brilliant in its stunts. One of the best action films ever made and one of the best flicks this year.This is not one of those films one watches for its impeccable narrative or picturesque scenarios. 'The Raid: Redemption' promises and delivers one thing: heart-pounding, fast-paced action scenes, with some virtual gore sprinkled-in by director-Evans for a maximal adrenalizing experience. If you are an avid fan of Pinkaew's 'Ong-bak', Chan-wook's 'Oldboy' or Tarantino's 'Django Unchained', rest assured that this film will undoubtedly tug at your heartstrings.

10/10 For what this movie aims to be, it pulls it off with absolute perfection. The Action: To begin, the fight choreography is spectacular, with most characters using the south-east Asian martial art form, known as silat, mixed in with a healthy dose of old school brawling and some rather creative destruction (of both people and the environment). Each strike has weight and impact, and it's just shy of being considered gore hound material, just barely above realism. Story: You might figure that a balls to the wall action movie needs no elaborate plot, and both I, and The Raid: Redemption, would agree with you; but The Raid still provides more story than I was expecting, and though nothing particularly original or ground breaking, it serves it's purpose, sets the stakes, and allows for some excellent tension. Tension, by the way, is something that other action movies should take a lesson in, and that this one delivers scene for scene. The actors even give a great performance, all of them fully realizing the deadly situation their in, and acting appropriately. Their expressions, body language, and manner of speech all contribute to the viewer feeling more invested in the action scenes, which is what this movie is about.!!!GO SEE THIS MOVIE!!!

Review title: My thoughts on Serbuan maut aka The Raid: Redemption (2011)
Review_body: I read many raving reviews of The Raid so I was quite excited when I heard it was going to be released in my country. At first only at 7 or 8 theaters but a couple of weeks later all through the country and even in my city. So I bought a couple of beers and went to the cinema with very high expectations. The reviews told me that the story was quite weak but the action was really in your face, violent and realistic. I've seen many Asian flicks that are considered classics even though they have a weak or simplistic story so I wasn't worried by that criticism.The theater had about 20 people in it, not much but who cares when you are going to see the best Indonesian action movie ever, right? Well how could I be more wrong.There are many descent action scenes, gun fights and some martial arts but they are all f*cked up because of the camera man. That guy is literally shaking it up and down, left to right in a way that every bit of raw and realistic action is downgraded to a messy and typically modern Hollywood action scene. He even knows to f*ck up a simple scene like two actors having a conversation by shaking the camera from left to right in such an annoying manner you really want to hurt the man with the camera. The violence and blood shedding is incredible but I wasn't impressed because you won't see a thing because of the way they filmed it.You cannot have any compassion with any of the actors because they are all dull guys trying to survive their task of killing all the bad guys. (maybe some of the bad guys are alright) and when they throw in some sentimental typical Hollywood clichés like "the wife that is pregnant" or "that bad guy is actually my brother" you know you've seen it before. (and far better) Asia has proved that they can make movies that can be commercially successful in the USA and Europe. Ong Bak did it for Thailand, The Rebel for Vietnam even Hong Kong put itself on the map again when releasing IP Man but this stinker doesn't give any credit to Indonesia cinema.During the movie I was thinking of the great movies Asia has made over 5 decades really pushing action cinema to the limits and always a step ahead of the movies made in Hollywood. The stunts of Jackie Chan, the sets of the old Shaw Brothers movies, modern South Korean thrillers, the realistic and violent fights by Tony Jaa, the stylish Japanese samurai flicks, well this film has nothing to be remembered by.Don't believe the hype and watch some old Barry Prima flicks instead. 50/100

Review title: For those who gave high rating to this movie.. You haven't seen any good action movies!!!
Review_body: To begin with, I can't believe those high rating and reviews, specially that one who wrote the best action film he's ever seen (clearly he has not seen anything). This movie has a lot of problems, specially when they make a retard special force team, i get that the story was that they get wiped out, but they looked so terrible, dying in every stupid way. I have seen plenty of military tactic movies, if you think that was good, i feel sorry for you. Also about the fighting style, I learned that was Indonesian Pencak Silat, but it was rather slow and predictable moves, nothing like old school Hong Kong martial art movies that comes with a variable of fighting style. One of the final scene when they face Mad Dog, he was UNKILLABLE, at one point I got bored and can't believe all the critical hit he took and he kept going, the fight got too long and lost its sense, it should have ended at one point when he got a tube stuck to his jugular, I mean, come on! Losing blood like that and he kept fighting like nothing? I normally don't write a review but I had to here because I can't believe all those people with the high rating.. I watched all the old school martial art movies, specially 70,80,90's Hong Kong Kung fu movies and all the other military tactical films, this one just gave me a face-palm.

Review title: One the best action movies ever
Review_body: This is what you call total non-stop action.Every fight scene is just wow, direction is superb.I have already seen it like 4-5 times. Became a fan of Iko Uwais after this.

Horrible fight scenes, horrible pacing, horrible story, horrible camera work, horrible dubbing, horrible propaganda. I think they spent more on bots giving this movie a good review than they did on the actual movie itself.

Review title: Wow is all I can say
Review_body: This movie is a nonstop adrenaline rush. The hand to hand combat is the greatest I've ever seen in any movie. The story is what it is but that's not why you need to watch this movie. Just be ready to have your mind blown with action, action, and more action
